history.content: If you are L&S I believe you can just go ahead. If you are in CoE I think you have to run it by your advisor first but it shouldn't be a problem. ========================================================================================================== I did this Summer 2018 and there was no issue with doing this. Just make sure to transfer in your transcript from the CC after the course is over :)
<md>If you are L&S I believe you can just go ahead. If you are in CoE I think you have to run it by your advisor first but it shouldn't be a problem.</md>

children.subject: I think you'd have to fill out a concurrent enrollment form and get your advisor's signature

I took classes at CC and at Berkeley in the same summer with a 3 week overlap. I emailed my advisor to make sure the credits were accepted, but they just directed me here: Assist.org

That's the official website that tells you which classes will transfer credit over. I believe it's only for California public colleges, which is perfect since you're planning to take them in Berkeley CC and transfer to UC.

history.content: Could I take both a Berkeley class and a community college class for credit this summer? Considering taking a CS class in addition to a CC R1B equivalent class.
history.subject: Community college class + Berkeley class over summer
